dao

Interface IPostingsList

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PostingsList

    public interface IPostingsList
    Defines the method a postings list needs to implement for a dictionary. Note that due to the way SPIMI dictionaries are created, we do not need to insert new docIDs at their correct place, but need only to insert them at the end of the list. Refer to "An Introduction to Information Retrieval" (Manning et al. 2009) pp. 73f.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(int docID)
      Adds the specified docID to the end of the postings list.
      void doubleSize()
      Doubles the amount of preallocated memory for this postings list.
      int getAllocatedSizeInBytes()
      Returns the number of Bytes preallocated for this postings list.
      boolean isFull()
      Returns whether this postings list is full or not.

        Doubles the amount of preallocated memory for this postings list.

        Returns whether this postings list is full or not.
        Returns:

        Returns the number of Bytes preallocated for this postings list.
